title: Image Shortcut Squeezing: Countering Perturbative Availability Poisons with Compression. (arXiv:2301.13838v2 [cs.CR] UPDATED)
abstract: Perturbative availability poisons (PAPs) add small changes to images to prevent their use for model training. Current research adopts the belief that practical and effective approaches to countering PAPs do not exist. In this paper, we argue that it is time to abandon this belief. We present extensive experiments showing that 12 state-of-the-art PAP methods are vulnerable to Image Shortcut Squeezing (ISS), which is based on simple compression. For example, on average, ISS restores the CIFAR-10 model accuracy to $81.73\%$, surpassing the previous best preprocessing-based countermeasures by $37.97\%$ absolute. ISS also (slightly) outperforms adversarial training and has higher generalizability to unseen perturbation norms and also higher efficiency. translated_title: 图像压缩缩短路径：用压缩技术抵御PAP攻击
translated_abstract: 毒物攻击(PAPs)在图像上增加微小的变化以防止其用于模型训练。目前的研究认为，实用而有效的对抗PAP方法并不存在。本文提出了一种新的压缩技术——图像压缩缩短路径(ISS)，成功应对了12种最先进的PAP方法，恢复了CIFAR-10模型的精度。研究表明，ISS的表现优于对抗训练，并具有更高的泛化能力和更高的效率。
tldr: 本文提出了一种新的图像压缩技术ISS，可成功应对12种最先进的PAP方法，恢复了CIFAR-10模型的精度，表现优于对抗训练。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new image compression technique, ISS, which successfully counters 12 state-of-the-art PAP methods and restores CIFAR-10 model accuracy, outperforming adversarial training in performance, generalizability, and efficiency.
